coverages.details: Covers non-refundable overseas transport and accommodation expenses if the trip is cancelled due to specified unforeseen circumstances, including serious sickness from COVID-19 (subject to eligibility conditions). The event causing cancellation must occur after policy purchase and within 30 days before departure from Singapore (unless accidental). Policy must generally be purchased at least 3 days before departure. Must meet destination/carrier COVID-19 requirements.
coverages.source_info: Page 5, Section 1; Page 3, Footnote 5; Page 10, Footnote 5; Page 11, Footnote 10

coverages.details: Covers additional administrative charges or non-refundable costs if the trip needs to be postponed due to specified unforeseen events.

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
Limit for extra expenses to return to Singapore - Per insured person

coverages.details: Covers unused, non-refundable travel and accommodation expenses paid in advance, plus extra costs to return to Singapore if the trip is cut short due to specified unforeseen circumstances, including contracting COVID-19 while overseas (subject to eligibility conditions). Must meet destination/carrier COVID-19 requirements.
coverages.source_info: Page 5, Section 3; Page 3, Footnote 5; Page 10, Footnote 5; Page 11, Footnote 10

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers reasonable additional accommodation and travel costs if the trip is disrupted due to specified unforeseen events.

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
For every six hours of delay while overseas - Adult
For every six hours of delay while overseas - Child
After six hours of delay while in Singapore - Adult
After six hours of delay while in Singapore - Child

coverages.details: Provides cash benefit for delays of scheduled public transport for more than 6 consecutive hours, provided the delay is not caused by you. Different rates apply for delays overseas vs. delays in Singapore before departure.
coverages.source_info: Page 5, Section 5; Page 2, Footnote 3; Page 10, Footnote 3

coverages.details: Covers costs incurred due to missing a connecting public transport due to the late arrival of the incoming confirmed connecting public transport.
Provides a benefit if you are denied boarding on a scheduled public transport due to overbooking, and no alternative transport is offered within 6 hours.

coverages.coverage_name: If the travel agency becomes insolvent
coverages.details: Covers loss of travel fares or accommodation expenses paid in advance due to the insolvency of the licensed travel agency.

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
For every six hours of delay while overseas - Adult
For every six hours of delay while overseas - Child
Baggage delay after six hours when arriving in Singapore - Adult
Baggage delay after six hours when arriving in Singapore - Child

coverages.details: Provides cash benefit for delay of checked-in baggage for more than 6 consecutive hours upon arrival at scheduled destination.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or damage of baggage and personal belongings

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
Limit for laptop - Per insured person
Limit for watches, jewellery or valuables in total - Per insured person
Limit for other items (for each item, set or pair) - Per insured person

coverages.details: Covers accidental loss or damage to baggage, clothing, personal belongings, valuables, and portable computing equipment during the trip, subject to per item and specific item limits.
Covers loss of cash or traveller's cheques due to theft, robbery or burglary during the trip.

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers costs of obtaining replacement passports, visas, or travel tickets lost during the trip, plus related additional travel and accommodation expenses.

coverage_categories.category_name: Personal Accident and Medical Expenses Benefits

coverages.details: Provides lump sum payment based on the scale of compensation (e.g., 100% for accidental death or permanent total disability, 50% for loss of one limb/sight in one eye/speech/hearing) if an accident occurs during the trip resulting in injury, disability, or death. Maximum compensation is the benefit limit. Classic plan does not include Public Transport Double Cover.

limits.type: Adult 70 years old or over (combined sections 14, 18, 19)
Limit for medical aids and equipment - Per insured person

coverages.details: Covers necessary medical expenses incurred overseas due to injury or sickness (including COVID-19) sustained during the trip. Includes treatment, hospitalisation, and cost of medical aids/equipment up to the specified limits. Age limits apply.

limits.type: Limit for medical aids and equipment - Per insured person

coverages.details: Covers medical expenses incurred in Singapore within 30 days of returning, for follow-up treatment of injury or sickness (excluding COVID-19 unless hospitalised overseas first) sustained during the overseas trip. Age limits apply.

coverages.coverage_name: Treatment by a Chinese medicine practitioner or a chiropractor

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person

coverages.details: Covers expenses for treatment by a licensed Chinese medicine practitioner or chiropractor overseas or in Singapore (within 30 days of return) for injury sustained during the trip. Subject to per visit and overall limits. Refer to policy conditions for specific requirements.
coverages.source_info: Page 8, Section 16; Page 2, Footnote 4; Page 10, Footnote 4

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person

coverages.details: Provides a daily cash benefit for each full 24 hours of hospital confinement overseas due to injury or sickness sustained during the trip.

Covers expenses for emergency evacuation (including due to COVID-19) to Singapore or the nearest appropriate medical facility if necessary due to serious injury or sickness during the trip. Must be arranged by the designated assistance provider. The limit for adults 70+ is combined with Sections 14 & 19, capped at the Section 14 limit (S$300,000).
coverages.source_info: Page 8, Section 18; Page 7, Section 14; Page 11, Footnote 10

coverages.details: Covers costs for returning the insured person's body or ashes to Singapore, or for local burial/cremation overseas, in the event of death during the trip. Limit for adults 70+ combined with Sections 14 & 18, capped at the Section 14 limit (S$300,000).

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person
Limit for accommodation expenses per room per night

coverages.details: Covers travel and accommodation costs for one relative or friend to travel to the insured person if hospitalised overseas for more than 5 consecutive days, or to assist dependent children travelling with the insured.

limits.type: Overall section limit - Per insured person

coverages.details: Provides a daily benefit if the insured person is unlawfully detained or held hostage during the trip.
Reimburses emergency telephone calls made to the designated assistance provider or for reporting loss of baggage/credit cards during the trip.

limits.type: Limit per item (for each item, set or pair)

coverages.details: Covers loss or damage to home contents due to fire or burglary while the insured person's home in Singapore is unoccupied during the trip (minimum 4 days trip duration usually applies).
Covers legal liability for accidentally causing injury to other people or damage to their property during the trip.
Covers the insurance excess payable on the rental vehicle insurance if the rental vehicle is damaged or stolen during the trip.

Provides cover under Sections 1 to 25 for losses arising from acts of terrorism. Limits shown apply specifically to Personal Accident (Section 13) benefits resulting from terrorism; for other sections, the standard limits apply.

limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply.

coverages.details: Provides cover under Sections 1 to 25 (excluding Section 15 - Medical expenses in Singapore, unless hospitalised overseas first) for specified events related to COVID-19, subject to the limits of the respective sections. Eligibility requires fulfilling all vaccination, pre-departure/post-arrival tests mandated by destination/carrier, and meeting specific conditions within each relevant section (e.g., trip cancellation requires serious sickness from COVID-19).

limits.limit: See limits of respective sections that apply.

coverages.details: If the policy is purchased after departure from Singapore (within 1 day, per-trip plans only), this covers losses under Sections 3 to 27 (excluding Section 8 - travel agency insolvency) that occur *after* the policy purchase time. It does not cover claims arising from known events or losses that occurred before the policy was bought.
